thread.title: Hot dams: the world's most spectacular water walls
thread.title_full: Hot dams: the world's most spectacular water walls

author: Telegraph Staff
title: Hot dams: the world's most spectacular water walls
text:
MORE... 
Named after US president Herbert Hoover, the man who oversaw its construction (though his successor Franklin D Roosevelt saw it completed), the Hoover Dam today celebrates its 80th birthday. Begun at the start of the Great Depression and finished in 1935 at a cost of $49 million (about $900 million today - £595 million) and more 100 workers’ lives, the art deco masterpiece of engineering on the Arizona-Nevada border was built on the Colorado River to generate power, control floods and provide irrigation water. 
Here are 12 more spectacular dams. Picture: Getty
